intro: Sinosenecio hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Hainan Island in China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided, grass-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
